messages.content:
# Developer Agent Steps Execution

You are the Developer Agent. You will be assigned a single feature to implement. Your goal is to complete it by following these steps precisely.

## Workflow

1.  **Analyze the Feature**: Read the feature's title, description and rejection (if provided) to understand its goal.
2.  **Consult the File Structure**: Use the provided `docs/FILE_ORGANISATION.md` to understand the project context.
3.  **Implement**: Write or modify files to meet the feature's acceptance criteria. Use the `write_file`, `rename_file`, `delete_file`, `list_files` and `search_files` tools for all file operations.
4.  **Complete the Feature**: When the feature is complete, you **MUST** call the `finish_feature` tool. This is your final step for a successful implementation.
5.  **Handle Blockers**: If you cannot proceed, you **MUST** use `block_feature` to explain the reason for being stuck - this signals that you are blocked and ready for a new assignment.

## Notes

For context on the overall project structure, including how tasks and features are organized, refer to `docs/FILE_ORGANISATION.md`. You should always update this file with new major directory changes.
#CURRENT TASK (ID: f67e8921-b197-40c9-9154-e95db8f27deb)
##TITLE:
UI Improvements
##DESCRIPTION:
Various UI improvements to the app


#ASSIGNED FEATURE: New Section in Settings - configuring github credentials (ID: bb3a99c3-4e37-47ae-b3df-4b6f5317faed)
##DESCRIPTION: This must be a new options section in @src/renderer/screens/SettingsView.tsx .
It must be persisted and the user can put in a username and a personal token.
It has to be persisted across sessions.




#ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA:

#TOOL SIGNATURES:
- read_files(paths: list[str]) -> list[str] - Read the content of one or more files at the given relative paths. Returns an array of strings (one per file).
- search_files(query: str, path: str = '.') -> list[str] - Search for files by name or textual content under the given path. Returns matching relative paths. The query input must be a space separated list of keywords
- block_feature(reason: str) - Stop work on the current feature and report why you are blocked (e.g., missing context, unclear requirements).
- finish_feature() - Mark the current feature as complete and end the run. Use only when the work fully meets the acceptance criteria.
- list_files(path: str) - List files and directories at a relative path from the project root.
- write_file(filename: str, content: str) - Create or overwrite a file with the given content. Always use this to write code or docs.
- rename_file(filename: str, new_filename: str) - Rename or move a file from one path to another.
- delete_file(filename: str) - Delete a file. Use with caution and only when necessary.
- run_test() -> str - Run the test for the current feature and return the output. Use to verify implementation.

#RESPONSE FORMAT INSTRUCTIONS:
You **MUST** respond in a single, valid JSON object. This object must adhere to the following structure:
```json
[object Object]
```
The thoughts field is for your reasoning, and tool_calls is a list of actions to execute.
Your response will be parsed as JSON. Do not include any text outside of this JSON object.
As responses to the tool calls you will send, you will also receive JSON objects in the form:
```json
{
"name":"tool_name",
"result":"..."
}
```

#CONTEXT FILES PROVIDED:
{"docs/FILE_ORGANISATION.md":"# File Organisation\n\nPurpose\n- Provide a high-level map of the repository so contributors and agents can quickly find the right area.\n- This is not a change log and not a per-file inventory.\n\nEditing Rules (read before updating)\n- Only document major directories and subsystems. Do not list individual files.\n- Keep bullets short (one sentence) and avoid \"New:\" or historical notes.\n- When adding/removing a major directory or moving a subsystem, update a single bullet here.\n- Prefer linking or pointing to deeper docs (README/OVERVIEW) rather than describing internals here.\n- Never document build related artifacts.\n\nTop-Level Layout\n- docs/: Project-wide documentation and specs; single source of truth for protocols and workflows.\n- src/: Application source (Electron app: main, preload, renderer, and tooling).\n  - live-data/: Main process live data service and types for live data services.\n    - providers/: Pluggable provider implementations (e.g., agent-prices bridge, generic fetch-json).\n    - registry.js: Provider registry to map service ids to providers.\n    - store.js: Persistence for service configs and cached snapshots by service id.\n    - types.js: Shared types and helpers (freshness policy, normalization, freshness computation).\n  - renderer/: React UI (components, screens, hooks, services, navigation, preview runtime).\n    - components/agents/: Agent-specific UI (status chips, run bullets, model selectors, project/cost/token chips).\n    - services/: Renderer-side services (e.g., pricingService for LLM price lookup via IPC).\n    - hooks/useShortcuts: Keyboard shortcuts provider; respects user-selected modifier and avoids interfering with text input.\n  - tools/: Developer and agent tooling (preview analyzer, factory integration, helpers).\n  - main.js: Electron main process entry.\n  - preload.js: Safe IPC surface exposed to the renderer (exposes live data API).\n- packages/: Local monorepo packages.\n  - factory-ts/: Agent orchestration library (orchestrator, pricing, history, completion, git integration).\n- scripts/: Project automation scripts and CLIs.\n- Root config files: package.json, tsconfig.json, tailwind/postcss configs, vite configs, forge config, .env.\n\nWhere to Learn More\n- Agents and roles: packages/factory-ts/docs (AGENT_*.md).\n- Factory TS overview and APIs: packages/factory-ts (see README/OVERVIEW files in that package).\n- Preview system: see src/renderer/preview and related docs in docs/ (preview usage and analyzer).\n- IPC and factory integration: src/tools/factory (renderer bridge and main process handlers).\n\nConventions (brief)\n- Keep cross-cutting documentation in docs/; place domain-specific or area-specific READMEs next to the code they describe.\n- Use descriptive directory names and keep responsibilities separated by area (renderer vs main vs tools vs packages).\n\nEnvironment & Credentials\n- .env at the repo root is used for local development (e.g., credentials consumed by tooling and factory-ts).\n\nNotes\n- If you are unsure whether something belongs here, it probably belongs in a local README under its directory, with this file providing only a one-line pointer to that area.\n"}

Begin now.

{"thoughts":"I will inspect the repository to locate src/renderer/screens/SettingsView.tsx and existing settings/persistence mechanisms, then implement a new section to capture GitHub username and personal token, ensuring persistence across sessions. I will update or create necessary storage utilities if missing and modify SettingsView accordingly.","tool_calls":[{"tool_name":"list_files","arguments":{"path":"."}}]}

{"thoughts":"Next, I will explore the src tree to find the SettingsView and understand existing persistence patterns to store settings across sessions.","tool_calls":[{"tool_name":"list_files","arguments":{"path":"src"}},{"tool_name":"list_files","arguments":{"path":"src/renderer"}},{"tool_name":"search_files","arguments":{"query":"SettingsView.tsx Settings View settings","path":"src/renderer"}}]}

[{"name":"read_files","result":"{\"src/renderer/screens/SettingsView.tsx\":\"import { useState, useCallback } from 'react';\\nimport { Button } from '../components/ui/Button';\\nimport { Select, SelectContent, SelectItem, SelectTrigger, SelectValue } from '../components/ui/Select';\\nimport { Switch } from '../components/ui/Switch';\\nimport { useLLMConfig } from '../hooks/useLLMConfig';\\nimport { useTheme, type Theme } from '../hooks/useTheme';\\nimport CollapsibleSidebar from '../components/ui/CollapsibleSidebar';\\nimport { useNavigator } from '../navigation/Navigator';\\nimport { useAppSettings } from '../hooks/useAppSettings';\\nimport { useProjectSettings } from '../hooks/useProjectSettings';\\nimport { useNotifications } from '../hooks/useNotifications';\\nimport { IconEdit, IconDelete, IconPlus } from '../components/ui/Icons';\\nimport { type ShortcutsModifier, type ShortcutsConfig, type AppSettings, DEFAULT_APP_SETTINGS } from '../../types/settings';\\n\\n// Settings Categories\\nconst CATEGORIES = [\\n { id: 'visual', label: 'Visual', icon: ðŸŽ¨, accent: 'purple' },\\n { id: 'llms', label: 'LLMs', icon: ðŸ¤–, accent: 'teal' },\\n { id: 'notifications', label: 'Notifications', icon: ðŸ””, accent: 'brand' }\\n];\\n\\ntype CategoryId = typeof CATEGORIES[number]['id'];\\n\\nexport default function SettingsView() {\\n const { availableThemes, theme, setTheme } = useTheme();\\n const { isAppSettingsLoaded, appSettings, setNotificationSystemSettings, updateAppSettings } = useAppSettings();\\n const { projectSettings, setNotificationProjectSettings } = useProjectSettings();\\n const { enableNotifications } = useNotifications();\\n\\n const { configs, activeConfigId, removeConfig, setActive } = useLLMConfig();\\n const { openModal } = useNavigator();\\n\\n // Layout state\\n const [activeCategory, setActiveCategory] = useState('visual');\\n\\n // Helper: capture a combo from a keydown\\n const captureCombo = useCallback((e: React.KeyboardEvent): string => {\\n const parts: string[] = [];\\n if (e.metaKey || e.ctrlKey) parts.push('Mod');\\n if (e.shiftKey) parts.push('Shift');\\n if (e.altKey) parts.push('Alt');\\n // Base key\\n const key = e.key;\\n // Ignore modifier-only\\n if (key && key !== 'Shift' && key !== 'Meta' && key !== 'Control' && key !== 'Alt') {\\n if (key.length === 1) {\\n parts.push(key.toUpperCase());\\n } else {\\n parts.push(key);\\n }\\n }\\n return parts.length ? parts.join('+') : '';\\n }, []);\\n\\n const onShortcutChange = async (keyName: keyof ShortcutsConfig, combo: string) => {\\n const next: AppSettings = await updateAppSettings({ userPreferences: { ...appSettings.userPreferences, shortcuts: { ...appSettings.userPreferences.shortcuts, [keyName]: combo } } });\\n return next;\\n };\\n\\n const resetShortcutsToDefault = async () => {\\n await updateAppSettings({ userPreferences: { ...appSettings.userPreferences, shortcuts: DEFAULT_APP_SETTINGS.userPreferences.shortcuts } });\\n };\\n\\n // Visual Settings content\\n const renderVisualSection = () => (\\n
\\n

Appearance

\\n
\\n \\n {\\n setTheme(e.target.value as Theme);\\n }}\\n className=\\\"w-64 p-2 border border-gray-300 rounded-md focus:border-brand-600 focus:ring-1 focus:ring-brand-600\\\"\\n >\\n {availableThemes.map((t) => (\\n \\n ))}\\n \\n
\\n\\n
\\n \\n updateAppSettings({ userPreferences: { ...appSettings.userPreferences, shortcutsModifier: e.target.value as ShortcutsModifier } })}\\n className=\\\"w-64 p-2 border border-gray-300 rounded-md focus:border-brand-600 focus:ring-1 focus:ring-brand-600\\\"\\n >\\n \\n \\n \\n
\\n This controls which key acts as the modifier for app shortcuts like Cmd/Ctrl+K and +N.\\n
\\n
\\n\\n
\\n

Keyboard Shortcuts

\\n

Click a field and press the desired key combination. Mod maps to your selected modifier (Cmd on macOS, Ctrl on Windows/Linux).

\\n\\n
\\n
\\n \\n {}}\\n onKeyDown={(e) => { e.preventDefault(); const v = captureCombo(e); if (v) onShortcutChange('commandMenu', v); }}\\n className=\\\"w-full p-2 border border-gray-300 rounded-md\\\"\\n placeholder=\\\"Press keys...\\\"\\n />\\n
\\n
\\n \\n {}}\\n onKeyDown={(e) => { e.preventDefault(); const v = captureCombo(e); if (v) onShortcutChange('newTask', v); }}\\n className=\\\"w-full p-2 border border-gray-300 rounded-md\\\"\\n placeholder=\\\"Press keys...\\\"\\n />\\n
\\n
\\n \\n {}}\\n onKeyDown={(e) => { e.preventDefault(); const v = captureCombo(e); if (v) onShortcutChange('help', v); }}\\n className=\\\"w-full p-2 border border-gray-300 rounded-md\\\"\\n placeholder=\\\"Press keys...\\\"\\n />\\n
\\n
\\n \\n {}}\\n onKeyDown={(e) => { e.preventDefault(); const v = captureCombo(e); if (v) onShortcutChange('addUiFeature', v); }}\\n className=\\\"w-full p-2 border border-gray-300 rounded-md\\\"\\n placeholder=\\\"Press keys...\\\"\\n />\\n
\\n

\\n \\n

\\n );\\n\\n // LLMs list content\\n const renderLLMsSection = () => (\\n
\\n
\\n

LLM Configurations

\\n \\n
\\n
\\n {configs.length === 0 && (\\n
No configurations yet. Click \\\"Add New Config\\\" to create one.
\\n )}\\n {configs.map((cfg) => (\\n
\\n
\\n
{cfg.name} {activeConfigId === cfg.id ? Active : null}
\\n
\\n Provider: {cfg.provider} â€¢ Model: {cfg.model || 'â€”'}\\n
\\n
\\n
\\n {activeConfigId !== cfg.id && (\\n \\n )}\\n \\n \\n
\\n
\\n ))}\\n
\\n
\\n Tip: Local providers must expose an OpenAI-compatible API. Use the Local preset to fill the default URL (http://localhost:1234/v1) and click \\\"Load Available Models\\\" to discover models.\\n
\\n
\\n );\\n\\n const renderNotificationsSection = () => (\\n
\\n

Notification Preferences

\\n
\\n {\\n if (checked){\\n const success = await enableNotifications()\\n if (success){\\n setNotificationSystemSettings({ osNotificationsEnabled: true });\\n }else{\\n setNotificationSystemSettings({ osNotificationsEnabled: false });\\n }\\n }else{\\n setNotificationSystemSettings({ osNotificationsEnabled: false });\\n }\\n }}\\n label=\\\"Enable OS Notifications\\\"\\n />\\n
\\n

Notification Categories

\\n
\\n {Object.entries(projectSettings.notifications.categoriesEnabled).map(([category, enabled]) => (\\n setNotificationProjectSettings({ categoriesEnabled: { ...projectSettings.notifications.categoriesEnabled, [category]: checked } })}\\n label={category.charAt(0).toUpperCase() + category.slice(1)}\\n />\\n ))}\\n
\\n
\\n setNotificationSystemSettings({ ...appSettings.notificationSystemSettings, soundsEnabled: checked })}\\n label=\\\"Enable Notification Sounds\\\"\\n />\\n
\\n \\n setNotificationSystemSettings({ ...appSettings.notificationSystemSettings, displayDuration: parseInt(value) })}\\n >\\n \\n \\n \\n \\n 3 seconds\\n 5 seconds\\n 10 seconds\\n Persistent\\n \\n \\n
\\n
\\n
\\n );\\n\\n return (\\n { setActiveCategory(c as CategoryId)}}\\n storageKey=\\\"settings-panel-collapsed\\\"\\n headerTitle=\\\"Categories\\\"\\n headerSubtitle=\\\"\\\"\\n >\\n {!isAppSettingsLoaded &&
Loading your preferencesâ€¦
}\\n {isAppSettingsLoaded && activeCategory === 'visual' && renderVisualSection()}\\n {isAppSettingsLoaded && activeCategory === 'llms' && renderLLMsSection()}\\n {isAppSettingsLoaded && activeCategory === 'notifications' && renderNotificationsSection()}\\n \\n );\\n}\\n\",\"src/renderer/services/settingsService.ts\":\"import { AppSettings, ProjectSettings } from \\\"../../types/settings\\\"\\n\\nexport type SettingsService = {\\n subscribe: (callback: (settngs: ProjectSettings) => void) => () => void\\n getAppSettings: () => Promise\\n updateAppSettings: (updates: Partial) => Promise\\n getProjectSettings: (projectId: string) => Promise\\n updateProjectSettings: (projectId: string, updates: Partial) => Promise\\n}\\n\\nexport const settingsService: SettingsService = { ...window.settingsService }\\n\",\"src/renderer/hooks/useAppSettings.ts\":\"import { useEffect, useState } from 'react'\\nimport { settingsService } from '../services/settingsService'\\nimport { AppSettings, DEFAULT_APP_SETTINGS, NotificationSystemSettings, TaskListViewSorting, TaskViewMode, UserPreferences } from '../../types/settings';\\n\\nexport function useAppSettings() {\\n const [isLoaded, setIsLoaded] = useState(false)\\n const [appSettings, setAppSettings] = useState(DEFAULT_APP_SETTINGS)\\n\\n useEffect(() => {\\n const update = async () => {\\n const appSettings = await settingsService.getAppSettings();\\n setAppSettings(appSettings)\\n setIsLoaded(true)\\n }\\n update()\\n }, []);\\n\\n const updateAppSettings = async (updates: Partial) : Promise => {\\n const newAppSettings = await settingsService.updateAppSettings(updates)\\n setAppSettings(newAppSettings)\\n return newAppSettings\\n }\\n\\n const setUserPreferences = async (updates: Partial): Promise => {\\n const next = {\\n ...appSettings.userPreferences,\\n ...updates\\n }\\n return updateAppSettings({ userPreferences: next })\\n }\\n const setNotificationSystemSettings = async (updates: Partial): Promise => {\\n const next = {\\n ...appSettings.notificationSystemSettings,\\n ...updates\\n }\\n return updateAppSettings({ notificationSystemSettings: next })\\n }\\n\\n return {\\n isAppSettingsLoaded: isLoaded,\\n appSettings,\\n updateAppSettings,\\n setUserPreferences,\\n setNotificationSystemSettings\\n }\\n}\\n\"}"}]

{"thoughts":"I need to inspect the settings types to see if GitHub credentials exist; if not, I will extend them and update main/preload persistence if required. Then I will add a new section in SettingsView to edit and persist username/token.","tool_calls":[{"tool_name":"search_files","arguments":{"query":"types settings AppSettings DEFAULT_APP_SETTINGS github token","path":"src"}},{"tool_name":"list_files","arguments":{"path":"src/types"}}]}

{"thoughts":"Open types and settings manager to see persistence and add GitHub credentials support.","tool_calls":[{"tool_name":"read_files","arguments":{"paths":["src/types/settings.ts","src/settings/SettingsManager.js","src/settings/appSettings.js","src/preload.js","src/renderer/types.ts"]}}]}

[{"name":"read_files","result":"{\"src/types/settings.ts\":\"import { NotificationCategory } from \\\"src/types/notifications\\\";\\n\\nexport type ShortcutsModifier = 'meta' | 'ctrl';\\n\\nexport type ShortcutsConfig = {\\n  commandMenu: string;      // e.g., 'Mod+K'\\n  newTask: string;          // e.g., 'Mod+N'\\n  help: string;             // e.g., 'Mod+/'\\n  addUiFeature: string;     // e.g., 'Mod+Shift+F'\\n}\\n\\nexport const DEFAULT_APP_SETTINGS: AppSettings = {\\n  userPreferences: {\\n    lastActiveProjectId: 'main',\\n    tasksViewMode: 'list',\\n    tasksListViewSorting: 'index_desc',\\n    tasksListViewStatusFilter: 'all',\\n    sidebarCollapsed: false,\\n    shortcutsModifier: navigator.platform.toLowerCase().includes('mac') || navigator.userAgent.toLowerCase().includes('mac') ? 'meta' : 'ctrl',\\n    shortcuts: {\\n      commandMenu: 'Mod+K',\\n      newTask: 'Mod+N',\\n      help: 'Mod+/',\\n      addUiFeature: 'Mod+Shift+F',\\n    },\\n  },\\n  notificationSystemSettings: {\\n    osNotificationsEnabled: true,\\n    soundsEnabled: true,\\n    displayDuration: 5,\\n  },\\n}\\nexport interface AppSettings {\\n  userPreferences: UserPreferences\\n  notificationSystemSettings: NotificationSystemSettings\\n}\\n\\nexport interface NotificationSystemSettings {\\n  osNotificationsEnabled: boolean;\\n  soundsEnabled: boolean;\\n  displayDuration: number;\\n}\\n\\nexport type TaskListStatusFilter = 'all' | 'not-done' | '-' | '~' | '+' | '=' | '?'\\n\\nexport interface UserPreferences {\\n  lastActiveProjectId: string;\\n  tasksViewMode: TaskViewMode;\\n  tasksListViewSorting: TaskListViewSorting;\\n  tasksListViewStatusFilter: TaskListStatusFilter;\\n  sidebarCollapsed: boolean;\\n  shortcutsModifier: ShortcutsModifier;\\n  shortcuts: ShortcutsConfig;\\n}\\nexport type TaskViewMode = 'list' | 'board'\\nexport type TaskListViewSorting = 'index_asc' | 'index_desc' | 'status_asc' | 'status_desc'\\n\\n\\nexport const DEFAULT_PROJECT_SETTINGS: ProjectSettings = {\\n  notifications: { categoriesEnabled: { general: true, files: true, chat: true, tasks: true, system: true, updates: true } }\\n}\\nexport interface NotificationProjectSettings {\\n  categoriesEnabled: Record<NotificationCategory, boolean>;\\n}\\nexport interface ProjectSettings {\\n  notifications: NotificationProjectSettings\\n}\\n\",\"src/settings/SettingsManager.js\":\"import { ipcMain } from 'electron';\\nimport IPC_HANDLER_KEYS from '../ipcHandlersKeys';\\nimport ProjectSettings from './ProjectSettings';\\nimport AppSettings from './AppSettings';\\n\\nexport class SettingsManager\\n{\\n  constructor(projectRoot, window) {\\n    this.projectRoot = projectRoot;\\n    this.window = window;\\n    \\n    this.appSettings = new AppSettings()\\n    this.projectSettings = {};\\n\\n    this._ipcBound = false;\\n  }\\n\\n  async init() {\\n    await this.__loadProjectSettings('main');\\n\\n    this._registerIpcHandlers();\\n  }\\n\\n  _registerIpcHandlers() {\\n    if (this._ipcBound) return;\\n\\n    // Note: ipcMain.handle signature is (event, args). We must read payload from the second param.\\n    ipcMain.handle(IPC_HANDLER_KEYS.SETTINGS_GET_APP, (_event) => this.getAppSettings());\\n    ipcMain.handle(IPC_HANDLER_KEYS.SETTINGS_UPDATE_APP, (_event, { updates }) => this.updateAppSettings(updates));\\n    ipcMain.handle(IPC_HANDLER_KEYS.SETTINGS_GET_PROJECT, (_event, { projectId }) => this.__loadProjectSettings(projectId).get());\\n    ipcMain.handle(IPC_HANDLER_KEYS.SETTINGS_UPDATE_PROJECT, (_event, { projectId, updates }) => this.__loadProjectSettings(projectId).save(updates));\\n\\n    this._ipcBound = true;\\n  }\\n\\n  __loadProjectSettings(projectId) {\\n    if (!this.projectSettings[projectId]) {\\n      this.projectSettings[projectId] = new ProjectSettings(projectId);\\n    }\\n    return this.projectSettings[projectId];\\n  }\\n\\n  getAppSettings() {\\n    return this.appSettings.get()\\n  }\\n  \\n  updateAppSettings(updates) {\\n    return this.appSettings.save(updates)\\n  }\\n  getProjectSettings(projectId) {\\n    return this.__loadProjectSettings(projectId).get();\\n  }\\n}\\n\",\"src/settings/appSettings.js\":\"import AppStorage from './AppStorage';\\nimport { DEFAULT_APP_SETTINGS } from \\\"../types/settings\\\"\\n\\nexport default class AppSettings {\\n  constructor() {\\n    this.appStorage = new AppStorage(\\\"app-settings\\\");\\n    this.settings = this.__load();\\n  }\\n\\n  __storageKey() { return `app_settings`; }\\n\\n  __load() {\\n    try {\\n      const stored = this.appStorage.getItem(this.__storageKey());\\n      return stored ? JSON.parse(stored) : DEFAULT_APP_SETTINGS;\\n    } catch {\\n      return DEFAULT_APP_SETTINGS;\\n    }\\n  }\\n    \\n  get() { return this.settings; }\\n\\n  save(updates) {\\n    const newSettings = { ...this.settings, ...updates };\\n    try {\\n      this.appStorage.setItem(this.__storageKey(), JSON.stringify(newSettings));\\n    } catch (error) {\\n      console.error('Failed to save app settings:', error);\\n    }\\n    this.settings = newSettings;\\n    return newSettings;\\n  }\\n\\n}\\n\",\"src/preload.js\":\"import { contextBridge, ipcRenderer } from 'electron';\\nimport IPC_HANDLER_KEYS from \\\"./ipcHandlersKeys\\\"\\n\\nconst FILES_API = {\\n  subscribe: (callback) => {\\n    const listener = (_event, files) => callback(files);\\n    ipcRenderer.on(IPC_HANDLER_KEYS.FILES_SUBSCRIBE, listener);\\n    return () => ipcRenderer.removeListener(IPC_HANDLER_KEYS.FILES_SUBSCRIBE, listener);\\n  },\\n  listFiles: (projectId) => ipcRenderer.invoke(IPC_HANDLER_KEYS.FILES_LIST, { projectId }),\\n  readFile: (projectId, relPath, encoding = 'utf8') => ipcRenderer.invoke(IPC_HANDLER_KEYS.FILES_READ, { projectId, relPath, encoding }),\\n  readFileBinary: (projectId, relPath) => ipcRenderer.invoke(IPC_HANDLER_KEYS.FILES_READ_BINARY, { projectId, relPath }),\\n  readDirectory: (projectId, relPath) => ipcRenderer.invoke(IPC_HANDLER_KEYS.FILES_READ_DIRECTORY, { projectId, relPath }),\\n  writeFile: (projectId, relPath, content, encoding = 'utf8') => ipcRenderer.invoke(IPC_HANDLER_KEYS.FILES_WRITE, { projectId, relPath, content, encoding }),\\n  deleteFile: (projectId, relPath) => ipcRenderer.invoke(IPC_HANDLER_KEYS.FILES_DELETE, { projectId, relPath }),\\n  renameFile: (projectId, relPathSource, relPathTarget) => ipcRenderer.invoke(IPC_HANDLER_KEYS.FILES_RENAME, { projectId, relPathSource, relPathTarget }),\\n  uploadFile: (projectId, name, content) => ipcRenderer.invoke(IPC_HANDLER_KEYS.FILES_UPLOAD, { projectId, name, content })\\n};\\n\\nconst TASKS_API = {\\n  subscribe: (callback) => {\\n    const listener = (_event, tasks) => callback(tasks);\\n    ipcRenderer.on(IPC_HANDLER_KEYS.TASKS_SUBSCRIBE, listener);\\n    return () => ipcRenderer.removeListener(IPC_HANDLER_KEYS.TASKS_SUBSCRIBE, listener);\\n  },\\n  listTasks: (projectId) => ipcRenderer.invoke(IPC_HANDLER_KEYS.TASKS_LIST, { projectId }),\\n  getTask: (projectId, taskId) => ipcRenderer.invoke(IPC_HANDLER_KEYS.TASKS_GET, { projectId, taskId }),\\n  createTask: (projectId, task) => ipcRenderer.invoke(IPC_HANDLER_KEYS.TASKS_CREATE, { projectId, task }),\\n  updateTask: (projectId, taskId, data) => ipcRenderer.invoke(IPC_HANDLER_KEYS.TASKS_UPDATE, { projectId, taskId, data }),\\n  deleteTask: (projectId, taskId) => ipcRenderer.invoke(IPC_HANDLER_KEYS.TASKS_DELETE, { projectId, taskId }),\\n  getFeature: (projectId, featureId) => ipcRenderer.invoke(IPC_HANDLER_KEYS.TASKS_FEATURE_GET, { projectId, featureId }),\\n  addFeature: (projectId, taskId, feature) => ipcRenderer.invoke(IPC_HANDLER_KEYS.TASKS_FEATURE_ADD, { projectId, taskId, feature }),\\n  updateFeature: (projectId, taskId, featureId, data) => ipcRenderer.invoke(IPC_HANDLER_KEYS.TASKS_FEATURE_UPDATE, { projectId, taskId, featureId, data }),\\n  deleteFeature: (projectId, taskId, featureId) => ipcRenderer.invoke(IPC_HANDLER_KEYS.TASKS_FEATURE_DELETE, { projectId, taskId, featureId }),\\n  reorderFeatures: (projectId, taskId, payload) => ipcRenderer.invoke(IPC_HANDLER_KEYS.TASKS_FEATURES_REORDER, { projectId, taskId, payload })\\n};\\n\\nconst CHATS_API = {\\n  listModels: (config) => ipcRenderer.invoke(IPC_HANDLER_KEYS.CHATS_LIST_MODELS, { config }),\\n  subscribe: (callback) => {\\n    const listener = (_event, chats) => callback(chats);\\n    ipcRenderer.on(IPC_HANDLER_KEYS.CHATS_SUBSCRIBE, listener);\\n    return () => ipcRenderer.removeListener(IPC_HANDLER_KEYS.CHATS_SUBSCRIBE, listener);\\n  },\\n  listChats: (projectId) => ipcRenderer.invoke(IPC_HANDLER_KEYS.CHATS_LIST, { projectId }),\\n  createChat: (projectId) => ipcRenderer.invoke(IPC_HANDLER_KEYS.CHATS_CREATE, { projectId }),\\n  getChat: (projectId, chatId) => notifications: NotificationProjectSettings\\n}\\n\",\"src/renderer/hooks/useAppSettings.ts\":\"import { useEffect, useState } from 'react'\\nimport { settingsService } from '../services/settingsService'\\nimport { AppSettings, DEFAULT_APP_SETTINGS, NotificationSystemSettings, TaskListViewSorting, TaskViewMode, UserPreferences } from '../../types/settings';\\n\\nexport function useAppSettings() {\\n  const [isLoaded, setIsLoaded] = useState(false)\\n  const [appSettings, setAppSettings] = useState<AppSettings>(DEFAULT_APP_SETTINGS)\\n\\n  useEffect(() => {\\n    const update = async () => {\\n      const appSettings = await settingsService.getAppSettings();\\n      setAppSettings(appSettings)\\n      setIsLoaded(true)\\n    }\\n    update()\\n  }, []);\\n\\n  const updateAppSettings = async (updates: Partial<AppSettings>) : Promise<AppSettings> => {\\n    const newAppSettings = await settingsService.updateAppSettings(updates)\\n    setAppSettings(newAppSettings)\\n    return newAppSettings\\n  }\\n\\n  const setUserPreferences = async (updates: Partial<UserPreferences>): Promise<AppSettings> => {\\n    const next = {\\n      ...appSettings.userPreferences,\\n      ...updates\\n    }\\n    return updateAppSettings({ userPreferences: next })\\n  }\\n  const setNotificationSystemSettings = async (updates: Partial<NotificationSystemSettings>): Promise<AppSettings> => {\\n    const next = {\\n      ...appSettings.notificationSystemSettings,\\n      ...updates\\n    }\\n    return updateAppSettings({ notificationSystemSettings: next })\\n  }\\n\\n  return {\\n    isAppSettingsLoaded: isLoaded,\\n    appSettings,\\n    updateAppSettings,\\n    setUserPreferences,\\n    setNotificationSystemSettings\\n  }\\n}\\n\",\"src/settings/appSettings.js\":\"import AppStorage from './AppStorage';\\nimport { DEFAULT_APP_SETTINGS } from \\\"../types/settings\\\"\\n\\nexport default class AppSettings {\\n  constructor() {\\n    this.appStorage = new AppStorage(\\\"app-settings\\\");\\n    this.settings = this.__load();\\n  }\\n\\n  __storageKey() { return `app_settings`; }\\n\\n  __load() {\\n    try {\\n      const stored = this.appStorage.getItem(this.__storageKey());\\n      return stored ? JSON.parse(stored) : DEFAULT_APP_SETTINGS;\\n    } catch {\\n      return DEFAULT_APP_SETTINGS;\\n    }\\n  }\\n    \\n  get() { return this.settings; }\\n\\n  save(updates) {\\n    const newSettings = { ...this.settings, ...updates };\\n    try {\\n      this.appStorage.setItem(this.__storageKey(), JSON.stringify(newSettings));\\n    } catch (error) {\\n      console.error('Failed to save app settings:', error);\\n    }\\n    this.settings = newSettings;\\n    return newSettings;\\n  }\\n\\n}\\n\",\"src/renderer/services/settingsService.ts\":\"import { AppSettings, ProjectSettings } from \\\"../../types/settings\\\"\\n\\nexport type SettingsService = {\\n  subscribe: (callback: (settngs: ProjectSettings) => void) => () => void\\n  getAppSettings: () => Promise<AppSettings>\\n  updateAppSettings: (updates: Partial<AppSettings>) => Promise<AppSettings>\\n  getProjectSettings: (projectId: string) => Promise<ProjectSettings>\\n  updateProjectSettings: (projectId: string, updates: Partial<ProjectSettings>) => Promise<ProjectSettings>\\n}\\n\\nexport const settingsService: SettingsService = { ...window.settingsService }\\n\",\"src/settings/SettingsManager.js\":\"import { ipcMain } from 'electron';\\nimport IPC_HANDLER_KEYS from '../ipcHandlersKeys';\\nimport ProjectSettings from './ProjectSettings';\\nimport AppSettings from './AppSettings';\\n\\nexport class SettingsManager\\n{\\n  constructor(projectRoot, window) {\\n    this.projectRoot = projectRoot;\\n    this.window = window;\\n    \\n    this.appSettings = new AppSettings()\\n    this.projectSettings = {};\\n\\n    this._ipcBound = false;\\n  }\\n\\n  async init() {\\n    await this.__loadProjectSettings('main');\\n\\n    this._registerIpcHandlers();\\n  }\\n\\n  _registerIpcHandlers() {\\n    if (this._ipcBound) return;\\n\\n    // Note: ipcMain.handle signature is (event, args). We must read payload from the second param.\\n    ipcMain.handle(IPC_HANDLER_KEYS.SETTINGS_GET_APP, (_event) => this.getAppSettings());\\n    ipcMain.handle(IPC_HANDLER_KEYS.SETTINGS_UPDATE_APP, (_event, { updates }) => this.updateAppSettings(updates));\\n    ipcMain.handle(IPC_HANDLER_KEYS.SETTINGS_GET_PROJECT, (_event, { projectId }) => this.__loadProjectSettings(projectId).get());\\n    ipcMain.handle(IPC_HANDLER_KEYS.SETTINGS_UPDATE_PROJECT, (_event, { projectId, updates }) => this.__loadProjectSettings(projectId).save(updates));\\n\\n    this._ipcBound = true;\\n  }\\n\\n  __loadProjectSettings(projectId) {\\n    if (!this.projectSettings[projectId]) {\\n      this.projectSettings[projectId] = new ProjectSettings(projectId);\\n    }\\n    return this.projectSettings[projectId];\\n  }\\n\\n  getAppSettings() {\\n    return this.appSettings.get()\\n  }\\n  \\n  updateAppSettings(updates) {\\n    return this.appSettings.save(updates)\\n  }\\n  getProjectSettings(projectId) {\\n    return this.__loadProjectSettings(projectId).get();\\n  }\\n}\\n\"}"}]
